General.text:
Type:
Vasopressors
Technically an inotrope as beta 2 stimulation causes vasodilation
Should use in combination with a
vasopressor
(eg
norepinephrine
) to avoid hypotension
Dosage Forms:
Common Trade Names:

Dosing.text:
2-20mcg/kg/min
10mcg works for most
May use in peripheral IV

2-20mcg/kg/min
10mcg works for most
May use in peripheral IV

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: B
Lactation:
Unknown if Dobutamine passes into breast milk
Renal Dosing
Adult
Not defined
Pediatric
Not defined
Hepatic Dosing
Adult
Not defined
Pediatric
Not defined

Adverse_Reactions.text:
Tachyarrhythmias
Myocardial ischemia
Hypotension
as β
2
effect may result in vasodilation
Caution if SBP <90

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life:
2 minutes
Metabolism:
In tissues and hepatically
Excretion:
Urine as metabolites
Mechanism of Action:β
1
stimulation with variable BP effects

Relative_Effects.text:
↑↑↑SV
↑↑HR → increases oxygen demand of heart → can worsen ischemia
↓SVR (transient, from β
2
agonism)

↑↑↑SV
↑↑HR → increases oxygen demand of heart → can worsen ischemia
↓SVR (transient, from β
2
agonism)

↑↑HR → increases oxygen demand of heart → can worsen ischemia
↓SVR (transient, from β
2
agonism)

Indications.text:
Cardiogenic shock
initial agent in low-output heart failure without requiring BP support
Tricyclic overdose
septic shock with low cardiac output to improve blood flow
